titles.title: To provide authority to the Federal Power Marketing Administrations to reduce vandalism and destruction of property, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Mr. Calvert moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2924.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 418 - 0 (Roll no. 397).

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 10/23/2001--Passed House amended. Authorizes the Administrators of the Western Area Power Administration, the Southwestern Power Administration, and the Southeastern Power Administration each to implement programs to reduce vandalism and destruction of property that is under their respective jurisdictions, and to provide rewards (including cash rewards) to individuals who provide information or evidence leading to the arrest and prosecution of individuals causing damage to, or loss of, Federal property. Limits such reward to a value of $1,000.
